website_summaries.verdict: The F-Lite 290 appears to be a comfortable and versatile option for cross-training. Even though some people expected the shoe to be lighter, it hasn't been an issue for the majority.
pros: Plenty of training aficionados laud the shoe’s versatility for CrossFit
They claim that it has the right balance of cushioning and support
A good number of users also consider it a solid choice for weightlifting because of its stable platform
The trainer offers a comfortable fit right out of the box, according to most buyers
cons: A few testers find the footwear a bit too heavy for their preference

customer_reviews.title: The company expects a costumer to pay return shipping for defective product
customer_reviews.text: The arch inside the shoe is right by the heel, terrible fit and costumer service, they want you to pay return shipping even for returning defective shoes.
customer_reviews.author: festive

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last
customer_reviews.text: I like Inov branded shoes, this is my 3rd pair and the more expensive version I have purchased, but it lasted the least amount of time. The soles are splitting in numerous locations, after just 4 months of use at the gym, and I never jog or run in these shoes. I am use to my weight lifting shoes to last a little bit longer, would not buy this version again.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Family Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great for CrossFit!!! Can’t go wrong with Inov8.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for CrossFit. Inov-8 never disappoints. A little more structured than my last pair but still lightweight. Still like my Alltrains for running but that’s not what this shoe is designed for. Tried going back to nike before I bought this pair immediately sent them back. Unless they get bought out and lower their quality, I’m an Inov8 customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: anna ethridge

customer_reviews.title: Nice features and fit...a little heavy
customer_reviews.text: Another great product from inov8. Very solid shoe for Crossfit, comfortable and stable. I had been wearing the Flite 235 and the 260 versions. Those are a little lighter than this version but this shoe feels very stable with weights, jumping and just about every movement. As usual, not the best shoe to run in but you can suffer through short distances encountered in the usual Crossfit WOD. My only gripe is the added weight, I'm not sure that whatever stability is added was worth it. Still lighter than comparable 'main stream' brands.
customer_reviews.author: E. Panousis

customer_reviews.title: Great workout shoe
customer_reviews.text: I liked the Inov-8 F235, I wanted a little more cushion for my workouts. Fits a little more snug than the F235, not in a bad way. I wear 11 1/2 running shoe, 11 dress shoe. I ordered this shoe in 11 1/2 and it fits great. I wear this shoe for weight lifting and cross fit exercises. Very happy with the fit and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Craig D.

customer_reviews.title: Premium shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first pair of Inov-8 and because I was so happy with my pair I decided to go for an updated version. It is a great shoe for Crossfit. It provides all the support i need for my WODs. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: New favorite shoes.
customer_reviews.text: For years I have used New Balance Minimus shoes for my CrossFit workouts and loved them. I decided to try these and have loved them so far (about 2 months use). Great room in the toe box and the footbed/arch support is just right for me since I'm flat footed.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: GOOD BALANCE BETWEEN A LIFTING SHOE AND A RUNNING SHOE
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for the gym if you do any type of Olympic lifts or any lifts that benefit from additional heal stabilization. There's a few extra pads around the achilles area that help stabilize the heal without being intrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Thor H.

customer_reviews.title: These are for cross-training
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are more or less specific to crossfit or some other cross-training type events. DO NOT purchase if you intend to regularly run any distance in these shoes... it's just not what they're made for.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Colbow

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting shoe
customer_reviews.text: The fit is perfect. I have a wider foot and these fit great even while wearing an athletic sock. I have nothing negative to say about the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: BuckRogers

customer_reviews.title: Satisfaction 💯 Waited to wear these until I wore out my Nano’s because I knew I would go back!
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best lifting shoe I have ever bought. Nice snug fit and tight lock on the ankle, no rising out of these. Love them. Just wish there were more color options so I can stock up on these to last the next few years!
customer_reviews.author: Kingzly

customer_reviews.title: Tighter fit than I’m used to.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought two pair of inov8’s over the past few years and 10.5’s always fit me. This version was way too tight and small for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: ForzaItalia

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair of Inov8 shoes, second for Crossfit. They are great and have just enough stiffness in the heel for most lifts. These have more cushion than by previous pair but that makes it great for running and other cardio workouts. Will buy more as I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits like Metcon3
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes so far. Really like the hold on the back of the heel.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sproat

customer_reviews.title: This is a beefy/durable shoe that has great support!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Inov-8 shoes, but will NOT be my last. These shoes feel great and very substantial for cross training and weight lifting. I'm IMPRESSED!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Go up 1/2 a size
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear an 8.5M and when I received the shoes, they were just a smidge too tight. I returned the 8.5M and ordered the 9M and VOILA! Perfect fit! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Derron Black

customer_reviews.title: I have found the best shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes!! Great for working out!! And good looking to just show off!!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly. I was worried because I ordered another pair of Inov’s (different model) that ran big. Not the 8s! True to size.
customer_reviews.author: anthony z.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great fitting shoe. Supports the heel during Olympic lifts. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for cross training
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes for cross training. Very light and comfortable. And has a great grip.
customer_reviews.author: MOHAMMAD YAZDANI

customer_reviews.title: Tough shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe for all that a workout can throw at you
customer_reviews.author: Robert L Frankforter

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product, Thought Out Design
customer_reviews.text: So many aspects of this shoe were designed with form and function. I have been pleasantly surprised by both how well the shoes fit as well as how versatile they have been for various exercises and workouts. I have enjoyed inov8s before but these were a step up in terms of a structured training shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. A bit weird at first with the padding around the heel but you get used to having the extra grip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good shoes for CrossFit exercise
customer_reviews.text: Does not provide great support for the cross fit exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Inov8 F-Lite 290 Training Shoes
product_meta.description: Inov8 F-Lite 290 Training Shoes The newest addition to the training range, the F-LITE 290 brings together everything we have learnt from a decade in the box and delivers it all in one perfect package for committed athletes. Unrivaled grip, lightweight agility, slipper-like comfort and tough-as-hell durability, this shoe will get you through every kind of workout, no matter how punishing it is. Now boasting a 4mm drop (heel to toe differential), the F-LITE 290 is set to hit the training sweet spot in 2018. Inov8 Shoe Fit Scale For technical footwear, a good fit is essential to enhance your performance. Inov8's new Shoe Fit Scale makes it easier to find the perfect fitting shoe. All Inov8 shoes are designed with Met-Cradle technology to lock down the mid-foot for a stable hold, where they differ is in the toe box. The shoes are now graded from 1 to 5, Grade 1 representing their closest, most precise fit and Grade 5 representing the widest fitting toe box. The lower the number on the scale, the narrower the fit, which ensures minimal internal movement of the foot when running fast on technical terrain. Shoes with the higher numbers on the scale will suit athletes with a wider foot and those wanting that extra comfort in the toe box. This wider toe box allows the toes to splay for increased stability when lifting heavy weights. It's also perfect for longer runs and races when toes begin to swell. Inov8 have graded the F-Lite 290 Training Shoes as Grade 4. Breathable Upper The upper of the F-Lite 275 is constructed using mesh fabric that allows air to permeate, ensuring your feet stay cool and comfortable when the temperature starts to rise. Additionally, synthetic materials work in tandem with the laces to provide you with a nice midfoot lockdown fit, keeping you tight within the shoe preventing any unwanted slipping but not tight enough that it makes you feel uncomfortable. Additionally, an internal heel cage wraps around the rear of the shoe and provides
feature_bullets: Rubber Toe Bumper - Provides added toe protection.
Exteroflow - Provides a high level of cushioning.
Power Heel - Provides maximum power and mechanical advantage when lifting weights.
